content.content: Introduction Hey everyone  On behalf of the DUX team  I’m happy to share another quarterly update on our roadmap. The intention here is to share an elaborate forum post and pre-recorded walkthrough every three months, in which we’ll wrap up the past quarter and commit to a focus for the next quarter. We’ll touch upon prior commitments and the progress we’ve made, lessons learned, and the prioritised themes for our roadmap. Enjoy the read and please do reply below if you have questions or suggestions!    Instead of reading, also consider watching the recorded walkthrough below in which I’ll talk you through this update.        Looking back: Q1 2022 It’s been a good quarter for our Core Unit overall. We were able to do meaningful work, deepen our collaborations with other Core Units and further map out our roadmap based on where MakerDAO is going. In addition to the above we’ve had a fantastic team offsite in Denver, CO mainly centered around the ETHDenver conference.   For those who are not yet familiar with the DUX (Development & UX) Core Unit, please head out to our Notion website.   What we’ve committed to At the start of this year we defined our roadmap focus for Q1, which was centered around the following three themes (and one added ‘surprise’):  Security  Scalability  Interactivity  (Landing page) In the list below you’ll find the features/initiatives that we committed to specifically.  Q1 '22 commitments960×540 217 KB   What we’ve delivered I’ll start with the juicy bit; for sure we’ve overpromised…  Looking back I think the prioritised themes made a lot of sense, but for some of the features/initiatives on this list I failed to estimate the amount of research and/or development efforts these would entail. We were able to deliver on the most important items (or at least make some good progress on them), but some of these items were left unstarted.    Please refer to the recorded voiceover for an elaborate rundown of each item’s status!  …or get a sense of the progress by looking at the list below.  draft Roadmap spotlight Q2 '22 (6)960×540 217 KB  All full release notes can be found here on our Notion website. Here’s a list of the delivered features since January 1st.  Q1 '22 delivered list product960×540 181 KB  Here’s a quick overview of delivered work outside of product updates.  Q1 '22 delivered list other960×540 191 KB   What we’ve learned I’m proud to say that we’re running a lot smoother and more efficient compared to Q4 '21. We’ve grown closer as a team, our processes have reduced friction & overhead, and overall we’ve found a dynamic that works. However as a fresh Core Unit (ratified September '21), we’re still learning and adapting. Our biggest learnings from past few months are listed below.    Don’t overpromise on quarterly roadmap—focus and deliver!   Real impact is achieved through (complex) cross-CU initiatives.   Our product roadmap needs to be in sync with MakerDAOs trajectory and other CUs.   We’re happy with the Immunefi bug bounty program but we need to actively contribute to refining its scope and process.      Please refer to the recorded voiceover for an elaboration on each of these!   Looking ahead: Q2 2022  Roadmap focus These past weeks we have been working to shape our roadmap for the upcoming three months. The intention was to align the roadmap with our sense of MakerDAO’s current priorities, ongoing/planned work at other Core Units, and what’s currently in progress at DUX. The resulting selection feels like the most relevant and impactful thing to work on, in addition to ongoing non-product-related initiatives. Once again; refer to the recorded voiceover for more details on each of the items included below.   draft Roadmap spotlight Q2 '22 (5)960×540 177 KB   Wrapping up I’ll close off by saying we’re proud to be part of this community and excited about the initiatives happening behind the scenes. As the project finds its way to success we’ll remain flexible as a product team and continuously adapt our team’s focus to whatever is important to MakerDAO. For now; we’re heads down on our way to the next Governance Portal release.  Lastly, as always…   Feel free to engage with us in the comments below in case you have any feedback, questions, feature requests or ideas for Maker’s governance tooling or process.   Thank you for reading!
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update on the DUX team's roadmap for Q2 2022. The author explains the progress made in Q1 2022, the commitments made, and the lessons learned. The post also outlines the roadmap focus for Q2 2022 and invites feedback, questions, and ideas from the community.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: 0xdeniz:  Real impact is achieved through (complex) cross-CU initiatives.   Good one. Nice progress. Thanks for this update!
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
